title: Analysis | Fact-checking the second Democratic debate (night 2)
subtitle: Here's a round-up of 13 claims from the second half of the second Democratic presidential debate of the 2020 campaign.
author: www.washingtonpost.com
vclaim: At another point in 1981, Biden said: “I think it is a sad commentary on this society when we say, as a matter of social policy, that we should make it easier for people who have neither the financial necessity nor the personal need to forget their responsibility to take care of a child all day from the time the child is an infant until the time he or she gets in school. I do not care whether in a modern marriage you want the man or the woman to take that responsibility. That has to be resolved by each couple individually.” (He also has voted for other kinds of child-care tax credits, though not for the wealthy.)
